title: Benjamin Clementine wins the Mercury music prize 2015 - as it happened | Music | The Guardian
summary: and the winner is benjamin clementine !
welcome to the mercury prize live blog 2015

text: ok that 's all from me .
alexis petridis will be along with his thoughts on the winner shortly .
thanks for reading !
so there we have it .
benjamin clementine is the winner of the 2015 mercury prize .
he gave a moving speech , despite being visibly lost for words , and broke down as he tried to dedicate it to paris in the wake of the terrorist attacks there .
at least for now is a deserving album - clementine is an artist with his own distinct voice , and one you suspect may develop further .

here 's what our own dave simpson said about the record channeling influences such as erik satie and antony hegarty , clementine is reminiscent of kevin rowland in that he sounds as if he is singing from the gut , and because he has to .
if only he had rowland 's economy : mannered vocal flourishes complicate the melodies when what 's needed is simplicity .
the addition of syrupy strings and pedestrian drumming further dilutes the impact of his raw talent .
however , when he performs unadorned , melodies dripping from his fingertips , and letting fly from the heart , his voice is difficult to forget .
you can read the full review here .
also worth having a read of this interview with tshepo mokoena in which he talks about his connection to paris .
benjamin clementine : 'i sang on the paris metro like i was playing in a stadium ' read more

documents.title: and the winner is benjamin clementine !
text: dunno what to say , '' he says , in a very hushed voice indeed .
thank you very much .
i 'd like to thank music .
i ca n't believe i 've actually won this . ''
he 's genuinely moved .
i never thought i would say this .
if anyone is watching , any child or youngster or student .
the world is your oyster .
go out there and get what you want to get . ''
and then he invites every single other nominee onstage with him .
this is all quite sweet .
he then dedicates the prize to the victims of the paris attacks and starts to cry .
clementine , of course , ran off to paris as a teenager and made a name for himself busking on the metro there .
the time has come to announce the winner , '' says laverne before engaging in another interview , which suggests the time has n't quite come has it ?
ghostpoet has apparently been nominated for this award every year since 1932 .
will he win this time ?
before we find out , there 's a quick recap of the time klaxons won the award while gurning off their faces off on rave drugs .
we 're very close to finding out the winner now .
are you excited ?
or could you literally not give the slightest toss ?
either way , they 're going to open the envelope and read out a name .
your thoughts have absolutely no impact on that happening .

documents.title: róisín murphy performs live
text: and she does so while holding a split mask of a human face over her own , while dancing like a robot .
it 's a bit twin peaks , and a suitable visual match for her slightly unsettling house-infused pop , in which even a rogue bassline can surprise .
talk to me about hairless toys , '' says lauren laverne to corinne bailey rae .
sadly for fans of general weirdness , she 's talking about the róisín murphy album .

documents.title: eska performs live !
text: eska was too scared to put herself forward as a pop performer for years , which is why she 's only getting noticed now that she 's in her 40s .
judging by her voice , or command of the stage , it 's hard to imagine her doubting herself .
i 'll have to lie down in a dark room after this , '' says mistajam .
maybe a few cups of tea could bring me round , but i 'm not sure . ''
agreed m8 , the sheer lunatic pace of it all is too much .
i am literally having to fill time here by live-blogging people visibly filling time .
it 's all too meta .
judges nick mulvey and mistajam are being interviewed now .
fun fact about nick mulvey : i once went into a tiny dark shed with the guardian 's music news editor harriet gibsone while he played us a song .
it was quite a strange , intense experience .
why am i telling you this ?
because otherwise i 'd have to report on mistajam claiming that florence has made a concept album '' , and nobody needs to hear that .
btw , fashion fans , mulvey is apparently helixing '' right now hipster hats : the art of 'helixing ' read more
aphex twin has been compared to mozart already today , and now francis bacon ( by mary anne hobbs ) .
it makes you wonder how he could not win the prize , given that nobody is saying such things about soak or florence welch .

documents.title: benjamin clementine is onstage !
text: just benjo and a piano i like the way his voice wavers like antony hegarty 's .
he 's a great performer , although i 'm not sure his album is quite as compelling as that previous winner 's was .
you can read a lovely interview with him here by my colleague tshepo mokoena benjamin clementine : 'i sang on the paris metro like i was playing in a stadium ' read more
deciding who wins the mercury prize is like eating christmas dinner , says kate mossman .
she said some other stuff that helped contextualise that statement but i was looking for something in my email at the time and missed it .
assume she meant that they all pull crackers and fall asleep in the middle of toy story .
more from hannah ellis-petersen who thinks she 's bloody david bailey now hannah ellispetersen ( @ hannahep ) slaves kicking things off # mercuryprize
no wonder aphex twin is n't there , '' emails my colleague will dean .
he 's busy publishing think pieces about anti-biotics on comment is free . ''
and so he is i believed we would face an antibiotics apocalypse - until now | richard james read more
we 're getting a history lesson now .
all the past mercury winners .
it 's a subject i 've become an expert on .
when i was young i thought that maybe i would specialise in something like ancient syrian linguistics or molecular chemistry .
but no , it 's speech debelle and young fathers .
you ca n't just and choose your destiny , guys .

documents.title: slaves perform live
text: raw punk energy , '' says laverne , before the injured of tunbridge wells take to the stage with wolf alice bloke on drums .
god they 're rubbish , like a lobotomised sleaford mods .
this will not win the mercury prize .
a run through the nominees , then .
aphex twin 's syro was fantastic , but seems decades old already , does it really still qualify ?
benjamin clementine has become a late favourite with his antony and the johnsons-esque piano folk .
and i ca n't actually type fast enough to keep up with the rest .
that 's two nominees for you , what more do you want ?

documents.title: we 're live on tv
text: lauren laverne is on tv !
and she never fails to seem enthused by the idea of a bunch of music industry people sat in a room deciding which british artist 's name will end up in an envelope .
i really should ask her to give me some enthusiasm lessons .
let 's not start this again .
or should we ?
gwilym mumford ( @ gwilymmumford ) @ timjonze uncle tembo no , we should n't .
the world does not need two mercury prize live blogs based around nothing but people replacing random words in sentences with the word tembo '' .
it was funny , briefly , in october 2014 .
but it 's not funny now .
or is it ?
ok we 're about to move over to the live coverage any minute on bbc4 .
i guess i could complain about being made to do this on a friday night , but the sad reality is that most of my friday nights are spent sat on the sofa , drinking red wine and watching shit tv .
so this is almost indistinguishable .
it 's the xx looking suitably awkward on a red carpet !
gavan/getty images look at jamie xx - now there 's a pop star who loves to hog the limelight .
no doubt he 'll get steaming drunk and throw that nominee gong at one of slaves later on
carygrant3000 20 november 2015 9:07pm jamie xx album is ok , but would n't it be great if eska won ?
in the comments , cary grant 3000 ( a collaborative side-project between cary grant and outkast ) gives a thumbs up to eska .
i 'd be happy if eska won it - her album has that slightly uncategorisable feel of a good mercury winner ( is it soul ?
folk ?
psychedelia ? ) .
if you want to know more about her then there 's a nice observer interview here .
it 's quite strange not being at the venue this year , and also not having already been blogging for about six hours by this point .
i 'm normally having some kind of breakdown by now and writing poetry about damon albarn 's favourite elephant just to fill the time .
i had a read over last year 's blog earlier today and i have to say i was mildly impressed by my ability to conjure up such a lengthy stream of utter nonsense without even a break to go for a wee .
you could almost consider what i do to be an art form .
but only if you had no idea as to the definition of the word art '' .
aphex twin might not be here but slaves are and they 're going to be performing despite the fact their drummer is very injured .

apparently a wolf alice is sitting in for him sinead garvan ( @ sineadgarvan ) joel from @ twitterid will drum for @ twitterid tonight after issac dislocated his shoulder # mercuryprize we can expect other live performances from roisin murphy , eska , benjamin clementine and c duncan .
some important food news from hannah ellis-petersen who thinks she 's the new jay rayner .
hannah ellispetersen ( @ hannahep ) i can report that the beef tastes like gravy-infused rubber there 's more where that came from .
reports ms ellis-petersen : roisin murphy had issues with the vegetarian menu option .

it was a stuffed pumpkin , heavy on the pumpkin as with the moon landing or jfk getting shot , you 'll surely never forget where you were the day you heard roisin murphy had an issue with the ratio of pumpkin in her mercury prize meal
last year i tipped outsiders young fathers and then spectacularly failed to put a single penny on that correct outcome .
still , plenty of my colleagues thanked me for making them a pretty penny the next day .
just seeing their smiling faces was payment in itself .
this year ?
i have n't got a clue tbqh .
but maybe i will say eska or jamie xx ?
or benjamin clementine ?
actually the ghostpoet album is pretty good .
how many guesses do i get ?
fancy seeing what guardian writers said about each nominee for this year 's best album made by a british person ?
well thank me later aphex twin - syro what we said : some would grouse that syro did n't reinvent music - a rather high bar that you have to regard as a compliment of sorts .
but if we do n't get aphex the innovator here , we get something just as good : aphex the virtuoso .
much of syro is rooted in an athletic 80s electro funk , typified by the inhumanly fast keytar runs of syro u473t8+e ( piezoluminescence mix ) .
but the album 's real hallmark is its generosity of melody .

from the delicate tonal shifts and syrupy vocal ooze of minipops 67 ( source field mix ) to the wistful , cloudy synths that swirl beneath the pneumatic junglist breaks of papat4 ( pineal mix ) , syro feels designed to delight and beguile . ''
( louis pattinson ) read the full piece here .

benjamin clementine - at least for now what we said : channeling influences such as erik satie and antony hegarty , clementine is reminiscent of kevin rowland in that he sounds as if he is singing from the gut , and because he has to .
if only he had rowland 's economy : mannered vocal flourishes complicate the melodies when what 's needed is simplicity .
the addition of syrupy strings and pedestrian drumming further dilutes the impact of his raw talent .
however , when he performs unadorned , melodies dripping from his fingertips , and letting fly from the heart , his voice is difficult to forget . ''
( dave simpson ) read the full piece here .
c duncan - architect what we said : he seamlessly merges interweaving vocals with the sounds of pastoral english folk and lush , 4ad-esque dreampop .

on he believes in miracles and the title track , both of which have a psychedelic shimmer , you realise that duncan is just as comfortable when creating music to suit sunnier climes , making this a magical record for all seasons . ''
( tim jonze ) read the full piece here .

eska - eska what we said : her debut album , five years in the making , attests to the londoner 's versatility , drawing on everything from psychedelic soul to folk infused with the spirit of kate bush .
the hypnotic opener , this is how a garden grows , moves at its own leisurely pace through history , evoking a half-cut erykah badu .
unsurprisingly , not every song 's that good - to be remembered is particularly forgettable - but , at its best , eska is a mind-bending gem . ''
( paul mardles ) read the full piece here .

florence + the machine - how big how blue how beautiful what we said : it takes about 10 minutes for the listener to realise that reports of welch 's new-found reserve might have been slightly over-egged .

it 's at that point that the title track appears , bringing with it that legendary musical signifier of modest understatement , a 36-piece orchestra : strings saw dramatically , brass blares out , little bursts of woodwind scurry about , what appears to be a dulcimer and something that sounds like a celeste attempt to muscle in on the action .
it 's understated only in the sense that she did n't get someone in to let off a cannon like in the 1812 overture .
the sneaking sus that how big how blue how beautiful perhaps is n't going to be entirely as advertised is hard to avoid . ''
( alexis petridis ) read the full piece here .
gaz coombes - matador what we said : matador 's sound textures are pulled together from a wide range of sources : a gospel feel on the chorus of 20/20 , a touch of neu !
in the english ruse .
there 's a trace of john lennon/plastic ono band , not only in matador 's use of slapback vocal echo , but also in its raw , confessional lyrics .
coombes 's voice has always been a powerful pop instrument , thrillingly on the edge of hysteria .
on matador , it 's also a howl of pain . ''
( jon dennis ) .
read the full piece here .
ghostpoet - shedding skin what we said : here , he takes a turn that might alienate fans of the icy , sparse electronic beats that launched his career .
with a backing band composed of guitarist joe newman , drummer john blease and bassist john calvert , ejimiwe dives headfirst into moody alt-rock territory .

his languid , spoken word-esque bars are still here , dripping over the title track 's exploration of homelessness and that ring down the drain feeling 's morose look at an ex-lover 's newfound happiness .
but he explores more universal themes than on his past work , stepping outside the tried-and-tested tales of big-city woes and one too many boozy nights . ''
( tshepo mokoena ) read the full piece here .
jamie xx - in colour what we said : in colour is no mere sepia-tinted nostalgia trip .

it might be a kaleidoscopic 11-track tribute to raves long past , a paean to the styles smith is too young to remember first-hand , and the incidental chatter of london pirate radio circa 1992 that he is too young to have heard - a direction presaged in last summer 's pre-album offering , all under one roof raving .

but it is also about the pleasure of being alone , enveloped in bass , in a sea of many ; of refracting what can often be a superficial experience - london clubbing - into something more existential , more nuanced , more unified . ''
( kitty empire ) read the full piece here .

róisín murphy - hairless toys what we said : from the glasslike gone fishing to its italo-disco and house mutations and unusual country diversions , it draws from the past but adds a crisp , modern polish ; and unlike other revivalists , there 's a depth to murphy 's vocals , as if she has experienced the freaks and fantasy of studio 54 firsthand .
hairless toys is pure , evocative elegance , her performance as flamboyant and fragile as the subculture she celebrates . ''
( harriet gibsone ) read the full piece here .

slaves - are you satisfied what we said : it 's not so much that slaves do n't capture the excitement of their live show on record , more that their live show is n't designed for transfer to a major label album .
the riffs of songs such as wow ! !
! 7am or hey or do something are strong enough , but the formula riff , primitive bash of drums , bellowed chorus '' wears thin pretty quickly .
great garage-rock needs to sound , in the words of john peel , as if the instruments are playing themselves , but on record slaves always sound a bit too self-conscious . ''
( michael hann ) read the full piece here .
soak - before we forgot how to dream what we said : it 's a debut that shows potential , but falls just short of the songwriting spark hinted at on her second ep , 2012 's sea creatures .

the derry singer 's cocooning , husky voice sounds as delicately expressive as always , creaking on the single blud - about overhearing her parents arguing with an ear pressed to her bedroom floorboards - and hailstones do n't hurt . ''
( tshepo mokoena ) read the full piece here .

wolf alice - my love is cool what we said : it feels like an album that 's been allowed time to gestate : despite being virtually veteran in buzzband terms , they have benefitted from beefing up their sound on tour - as evidenced on the heavy romance of your loves whore , the dirty degenerate chug of you 're a germ , or the cinematic turn to dust .

the awkward introversion in the lyrics - which deal with relationship strife , creepy blokes , friendship , gender and the quest for eternal love - add a sense of emotional overload driven by late nights , blood pacts and wide-eyed wonder .
it 's an invigorating debut with a gaunt , gallant identity of its own . ''
( harriet gibsone ) read the full piece here .
resiktd 20 november 2015 8:21pm aphex twin is the mozart of our times and comes from another dimension.we must all do everything in our power to encourage him to release more new music .
getting in early in the comments comes this vote for mozart .
we all love a bit of mozart but did he ever put out anything as good as that slaves album ?
hannah ellis-petersen is at the ceremony itself and despite being crap at recognising celebrities '' she 's already gathered more gossip than i manage in four hours .
things such as this hannah ellispetersen ( @ hannahep ) for those with excellent eyes , the elite mercury prize dinner guestlist ( spoiler : aphex twin has not turned up ) and this !

hannah ellispetersen ( @ hannahep ) and this is what the mercury- approved slebs are eating aka what is served at every awards : fish , beef , chocolate so they 're all eating a shedload of meat and potatoes infused with coffee .
and aphex twin has n't bothered turning up ( a surprise given his well-publicised love of red carpet events and coffee-infused potatoes )

documents.title: welcome to the mercury prize live blog 2015
text: hello and welcome to this year 's mercury prize live blog , where it 's all change !
there 's a new venue ( the langham hotel , marylebone ) , a new time of year ( friday night !
late november ! )
and a new media outlet providing coverage ( 6music as we speak , then bbc4 from 9.30pm until 10.30pm ) .
and yet despite this so called all-change '' , there is one thing that remains reassuringly constant : yes , that 's right readers , i am still liveblogging the damn thing .
like the north star guiding a lonely shepherd to his flock , or a red wine stain on a cream cable-knit jersey , i remain a permanent , unshiftable fixture here .
it does n't matter that the mercury has changed .
it could be held in zagreb , reconfigured as a custard pie throwing competition and be conducted entirely via the medium of mime , and i would still somehow find myself blogging it .

so without further ado , here 's a reminder of this year 's nominees who are all competing to have made the best british album of the last twelve months ( their current odds of winning in brackets ) aphex twin - syro ( 12/1 ) benjamin clementine - at least for now ( 9/2 ) c duncan - architect ( 20/1 ) eska - eska ( 8/1 ) florence + the machine - how big how blue how beautiful ( 20/1 ) gaz coombes - matador ( 16/1 ) ghostpoet - shedding skin ( 8/1 ) jamie xx - in colour ( 4/1 ) róisín murphy - hairless toys ( 14/1 ) slaves - are you satisfied ( 12/1 ) soak - before we forgot how to dream ( 12/1 ) wolf alice - my love is cool ( 7/1 ) stay tuned to this blog - for the next hour or so i 'll be discussing the nominees and rounding up gossip from hannah ellis-petersen , who is at the event itself rather than sat with me in my lounge ( that would be a little weird ) .
then , from 9.30pm to 10.30pm , i 'll bring you coverage of the ceremony itself , right up to the moment the prize is announced .
and if you all behave nicely , i might even stick around for a bit of post-prize analysis , too .

key_events.text:
10.25pm GMT
22:25
And the winner is ... Benjamin Clementine!

8.12pm GMT
20:12
Welcome to the Mercury Prize live blog 2015

bulletin.text: Who made the best British album of the last 12 months? A panel of music people decided it was Benjamin Clementine with At Least For Now.
